lines.text: My that coffee smells good. Ain't it funny how coffee never tastes as good as it smells.
the aroma is always better than the actuality. May that be your thought for the day.

[sarcastically]
Your ethics touch me deeply.
Noblesse oblige...
If you go to the police, you'll see Laurie sooner than you think.
Are you trying to scare me?

I'm just warning you. Perhaps you don't realize - it's painful being killed. A piece of metal sliding into your body, finding its way into your heart. Or a bullet tearing through your skin, crashing into a bone. It takes a while to die, too. Sometimes a long while.
I've got a dame on my mind - and she's dead. That's plenty for me.
Oh, I see. You cross the tracks on May Day with a basket of goodies for the poor slum kid, but back you scoot - and fast - to your own neck o' the woods. Don't you?
I wouldn't say that.
No, you wouldn't *say* it... but that's the way it is.
Oh, why not? If you're glad about the divorce, you ought to celebrate. And if you're sad and wanna forget about it, you ought to celebrate. So either way, you ought to celebrate.
You know, you ought to put on some meat, Laury. You're so skinny, can't grab hold of you anywhere.
I haven't noticed anybody having any trouble.

In that case, I shall have to forge ahead with my inquiry. And may I remind you that Nevada courts have rather puritanical views. Why some of our more impassioned juries even insist that a man who commits murder pay with his life.
You're the coldest iceberg of a woman I ever saw, and the rottenest inside. I've seen plenty, too. I wouldn't trade places with you if they sliced me into little pieces.

[to Sam, approvingly]
You're not a turnip, are you?
I must warn you, though, liquor makes me nosy. I've been known to ask all sorts of personal questions after four cocktails.
'Sallright. I've been known to tell people to mind their own business. Cold sober, too.
It's quite all right, Mrs. Brent. I am a man of integrity, but I'm always willing to listen to an interesting offer.
Well, I'm prepared to pay handsomely.
Good. Obstructing the wheels of justice is a costly affair.
Five thousand dollars should do it.
Fifteen thousand dollars should do it.
Has it occurred to you? Neither of us looks like a scoundrel, do we?
How come you got a hold of this information?
Through underworld connections, like it says in the newspapers. I'm a bad boy.
And remember, glamour girl, I'll do this on just one condition.
What's that?
That you don't make any passes at me when you get me out there. I'm a very shy kid.
You can't just go around killing people when the notion strikes you. It's just not feasible.
Which will, believe me, be exceedingly painful to a man of my integrity.
It won't hurt half as much as me to lose my $500.
Don't get mad.
I am getting mad. I resent people marching into something that doesn't concern them.
You think it doesn't. It concerns me all right, if it concerns Sam.
You never see a thing except what you want to see, do you?
Well, I'll tell you this much. You won't get another nickel as long as I live. And when I die, you still won't. I'll see to that first thing in the morning.
Little fool. You're crazy.
If I am, at least I'm crazy with love for a man. All you're crazy about is money and yourself.

[to Sam]
You're strength, excitement, and depravity!
